      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void add​(int num)
      Adds the given value to the value stored within this instance
      void advance​(int num)
      Move the cursor one half character length to the right
      void assign​(int num)
      Store the given value in this instance as its current value
      void back​(int num)
      Move the cursor one half character length to the left
      void carriagereturn()
      Moves the current cursor position back the number of units equal to the number of digits of the stored value in this instance in base 10
      void div​(int num)
      Divide the value stored within this instance by the given value
      void draw()
      Draws the current value of this instance at the current cursor position The cursor will be advanced the # of digits present in the current value in base 10 Negative numbers arent displayed properly
      void fillScreen​(java.awt.Color color)
      fills the entire screen with color this method preserves the turtles state (rotation, position and, color)
      int get()
      Gets the current value of this instance
      void linefeed()
      Moves the current cursor position down one line
      void mul​(int num)
      Multiply the given value to the stored within this instance
      void resetScreen()
      Clear the screen to Color.WHITE and reset the cursor position
      void setScale​(double scale)
      Sets the current scale (width of character) of this tabulator
      void sub​(int num)
      Subtracts the given value to the value stored within this instance
